query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 ‘Per me si va ne la città dolente, 2 per me si va ne l’etterno dolore, 3 per me si va tra la perduta gente.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Through me one goes to the city of woe, 2 through me one goes to eternal sorrow, 3 through me one goes among the lost people.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Mama dvārena gacchati nagarīṃ śokasya, 2 Mama dvārena gacchati śoko nityaḥ, 3 Mama dvārena gacchati janāḥ naṣṭāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Giustizia mosse il mio alto fattore; 5 fecemi la divina podestate, 6 la somma sapïenza e ’l primo amore.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Justice moved my exalted Maker; 5 divine power made me, 6 supreme wisdom and primal love.
**Sanskrit:**
4 Nyāyena prayojitaḥ mama uttamaḥ kartā; 5 mama sṛṣṭiṃ cakāra daivī śaktiḥ, 6 parā prajñā ca ādyam prema ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Dinanzi a me non fuor cose create 8 se non etterne, e io etterno duro. 9 Lasciate ogne speranza, voi ch’intrate’.
query.result:
**English:**
7 Before me there were no created things, 8 only eternal things, and I endure eternally. 9 Abandon all hope, you who enter here.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Mama puras tan na babhūva kiñcid utpannam 8 Api tu nityam eva aham nityo 'ham asmi. 9 Tyajata sarvāśāḥ yūyam ye praveśayanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Queste parole di colore oscuro 11 vid’ ïo scritte al sommo d’una porta; 12 per ch’io: «Maestro, il senso lor m’è duro».
query.result:
**English:**
10 These words of dark color 11 I saw written at the top of a gate; 12 because of which I said: "Master, their meaning is hard for me".
**Sanskrit:**
10 Imāni vacāṃsi kṛṣṇavarṇāni 11 Apaśyam likhitāni ekaśilāyāḥ śikhara uttamam prati; 12 Tatas tadāhaṃ: "Ācārya, eṣām arthaḥ mama durbodhaḥ asti".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Ed elli a me, come persona accorta: 14 «Qui si convien lasciare ogne sospetto; 15 ogne viltà convien che qui sia morta.
query.result:
**English:**
13 And he to me, as one who is wise: 14 "Here it is necessary to abandon all suspicion; 15 all cowardice must be dead here.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Sa ca mama, yathā vyavasāyī kaścit: 14 "Atra sarvaḥ saṃśayaḥ parityājyate; 15 atra sarvā kāpuruṣatā mṛtā bhavatu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Noi siam venuti al loco ov’ i’ t’ho detto 17 che tu vedrai le genti dolorose 18 c’hanno perduto il ben de l’intelletto».
query.result:
**English:**
16 We have come to the place of which I told you, 17 where you will see the sorrowful people 18 who have lost the good of the intellect.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Vayam āgatāḥ sma tasmin sthāne yasya tvām ahaṃ prāhavam, 17 Yatra drakṣyasi janān duḥkhitān, 18 Ye naṣṭavanto buddheḥ śubham.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 E poi che la sua mano a la mia puose 20 con lieto volto, ond’ io mi confortai, 21 mi mise dentro a le segrete cose.
query.result:
**English:**
19 And after she placed her hand in mine 20 with a joyful countenance, which comforted me, 21 she led me into the secret things.
**Sanskrit:**
19 Atha yadā sā mama haste svakīyam hastaṃ nyadhāt 20 hṛṣṭavaktreṇa, yena aham samāśvāsaṃ prāpaḥ, 21 tadā sā mamaṃ guhyāni vastu guhyāni vastu pradarśayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Quivi sospiri, pianti e alti guai 23 risonavan per l’aere sanza stelle, 24 per ch’io al cominciar ne lagrimai.
query.result:
**English:**
22 There sighs, cries, and loud lamentations 23 resounded through the starless air, 24 so that at the beginning I wept.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Tatrāśru-vilāpāḥ parusāḥ krandanāni ca 23 naksatra-rahitasya nabhasaḥ praviśanti sma, 24 yataḥ aham ārambhe aśrūn apapātam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Diverse lingue, orribili favelle, 26 parole di dolore, accenti d’ira, 27 voci alte e fioche, e suon di man con elle
28 facevano un tumulto, il qual s’aggira 29 sempre in quell’ aura sanza tempo tinta, 30 come la rena quando turbo spira.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Diverse tongues, horrible languages, 26 words of pain, accents of anger, 27 loud and hoarse voices, and sounds of hands with them
28 made a tumult, which whirls around 29 always in that air stained without time, 30 like the sand when a whirlwind blows.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Nānāvidhā bhāṣāḥ, ghorāḥ kathāḥ, 26 duḥkhavacanāni, krodhābhimukhāni padāni, 27 uccāvacāḥ śabdāḥ, hastaghātaśabdāśca saha taiḥ
28 kṣobhaṃ kurvanti, yaḥ saṃcarati 29 sadā tasmin vāyau kālena anākulaṃ kṛte, 30 yathā vālukā yadā prabalaḥ vāyuḥ pravāhati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 E io ch’avea d’error la testa cinta, 32 dissi: «Maestro, che è quel ch’i’ odo? 33 e che gent’ è che par nel duol sì vinta?».
query.result:
**English:**
31 And I, whose head was bound with error, 32 said: "Master, what is that which I hear? 33 And what people are these who seem so overcome with grief?"
**Sanskrit:**
31 Ahaṃ ca yasya śiraḥ mogheṇa āvṛtam āsīt, 32 uvāca: "Guru, kim etad yat śṛṇomi? 33 Ke ca ete janāḥ ye duḥkhe evaṃ parājitāḥ iva prāyante?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Ed elli a me: «Questo misero modo 35 tegnon l’anime triste di coloro 36 che visser sanza ’nfamia e sanza lodo.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And they to me: "This wretched mode 35 the sad souls of those who lived 36 without infamy or praise maintain.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Eva ca te mayā vakṣye: "Etad duḥkhitaṃ rūpaṃ 35 Dhārayanti jīvātmānaḥ teṣāṃ ye jīvitam anīrṇīyam ajīvan, 36 Yeṣāṃ kīrtir na śubhā na ca aśubhā āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Mischiate sono a quel cattivo coro 38 de li angeli che non furon ribelli 39 né fur fedeli a Dio, ma per sé fuoro.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Mingled are with that evil choir 38 of the angels who were neither rebellious 39 nor faithful to God, but were for themselves.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Miśritāḥ santi tena pāpakeṇa gaṇena 38 Teṣām devadūtānām ye na babhūvuḥ vidrohiṇaḥ 39 Na ca babhūvuḥ bhaktitasya devāya, kim tu ātmanaḥ eva āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Caccianli i ciel per non esser men belli, 41 né lo profondo inferno li riceve, 42 ch’alcuna gloria i rei avrebber d’elli».
query.result:
**English:**
40 Heaven chases them away so as not to be less beautiful, 41 and deep hell does not receive them, 42 for the kings would have some glory from them.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Svargāḥ tānapakurvanti na svayam adhikaśobhāḥ santu iti, 41 na ca gambhīraḥ narakaḥ tānaṅgīkaroti, 42 yataḥ tebhyaḥ rājānaḥ kaścid yaśaḥ prāpsyanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 E io: «Maestro, che è tanto greve 44 a lor che lamentar li fa sì forte?». 45 Rispuose: «Dicerolti molto breve.
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I: "Master, what is so grievous 44 to them that makes them lament so loudly?". 45 He replied: "I will tell you very briefly.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Aham ca: "He gurū, kim idam atibhāri 44 yeṣām krandanam evam mahāśabdam karoti?". 45 Sa uvāca: "Vakṣyāmi tubhyaṃ bahu saṃkṣepataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Questi non hanno speranza di morte, 47 e la lor cieca vita è tanto bassa, 48 che ’nvidïosi son d’ogne altra sorte.
query.result:
**English:**
46 These have no hope of death, 47 and their blind life is so base, 48 that they are envious of every other fate.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Eteṣām mṛtyoḥ āśā nāsti, 47 Eva ca andhā jīvitaṃ tāvatīnamnam asti, 48 Yataḥ ete anyasya sarvasya bhagadhīyāḥ santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Fama di loro il mondo esser non lassa; 50 misericordia e giustizia li sdegna: 51 non ragioniam di lor, ma guarda e passa».

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Poscia ch’io v’ebbi alcun riconosciuto, 59 vidi e conobbi l’ombra di colui 60 che fece per viltade il gran rifiuto.
query.result:
**English:**
58 After I had recognized some of them, 59 I saw and recognized the shade of him 60 who made the great refusal through cowardice.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Tataḥ aham tatra keñcid abhijñāya, 59 apaśyam ajānāṃ chayayāṃ tasya, 60 yaḥ kāpuruṣatvāt mahatīm nivṛttim akārṣīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Incontanente intesi e certo fui 62 che questa era la setta d’i cattivi, 63 a Dio spiacenti e a’ nemici sui.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Immediately I knew and was certain 62 that this was the sect of the wicked, 63 hateful to God and to His enemies.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Tatas tāṃ dṛṣṭvā niścitam manye 62 ayam durātmanām sampradāyaḥ, 63 dveṣyaḥ parameśvareṇa tasya ca śatruṇā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Questi sciaurati, che mai non fur vivi, 65 erano ignudi e stimolati molto 66 da mosconi e da vespe ch’eran ivi.
query.result:
**English:**
64 These wretches, who never were alive, 65 were naked and much tormented 66 by gadflies and wasps that were there.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Ime durātmanaḥ ye na kadācid api jīvanti sma, 65 nagnāḥ āsīt bahu ca pidyamānāḥ, 66 daṃśamaśakair daṃśamadhumakhair ye tatra āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Elle rigavan lor di sangue il volto, 68 che, mischiato di lagrime, a’ lor piedi 69 da fastidiosi vermi era ricolto.
query.result:
**English:**
67 They bathed their faces with blood, 68 which, mixed with tears, was gathered at their feet 69 by loathsome worms.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Raktena te mukham aplavayan, 68 Yaḥ aśrubhiḥ saṃyuktaḥ pādapadmābhyām 69 Kṛmibhiḥ pidayā yuktaḥ saṃgṛhītaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 E poi ch’a riguardar oltre mi diedi, 71 vidi genti a la riva d’un gran fiume; 72 per ch’io dissi: «Maestro, or mi concedi
73 ch’i’ sappia quali sono, e qual costume 74 le fa di trapassar parer sì pronte, 75 com’ i’ discerno per lo fioco lume».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And then, when I gave myself to looking further, 71 I saw people on the bank of a great river; 72 wherefore I said: "Master, now grant me
73 that I may know who they are, and what custom 74 makes them seem so ready to cross over, 75 as I discern by the faint light".
**Sanskrit:**
70 Tataśca punarapi paśyāmi dūrato, 71 janaṃ nadi-tīre mahati sthitaṃ, 72 tasmāt ahaṃ vadāmi: "Bhagavan, me anujānīhi,
73 ye ete jānanti, kaścaiva teṣāṃ ācāraḥ, 74 yaḥ teṣāṃ paryāyaṇe tāvad-utsukān iva darśayati, 75 yathāhaṃ jānāmi mandena prakāśena".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Ed elli a me: «Le cose ti fier conte 77 quando noi fermerem li nostri passi 78 su la trista riviera d’Acheronte».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And he to me: "Things will be faithfully reported to you 77 when we stop our steps 78 on the sad shore of Acheron."
**Sanskrit:**
76 Sa ca mama: "Viṣyāṇi te viśvasya kathaniyāni bhaviṣyanti 77 yadā vayam nirodhiṣyāmaḥ padavīṃ naḥ 78 Asikanyāyāḥ tīre duḥkhāya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Allor con li occhi vergognosi e bassi, 80 temendo no ’l mio dir li fosse grave, 81 infino al fiume del parlar mi trassi.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Then with downcast and ashamed eyes, 80 fearing that my speech might be offensive to him, 81 I drew myself back to the river of speech.
**Sanskrit:**
79 Tatra lajjayā nīcaiḥ śiraḥ kṛtvā, 80 mama vacanaṃ na rocate iti bibhyataḥ, 81 vāgdevyāḥ pravāhaṃ prati pratyāvartam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Ed ecco verso noi venir per nave 83 un vecchio, bianco per antico pelo, 84 gridando: «Guai a voi, anime prave!
85 Non isperate mai veder lo cielo: 86 i’ vegno per menarvi a l’altra riva 87 ne le tenebre etterne, in caldo e ’n gelo.
query.result:
**English:**
82 And behold, towards us came by boat 83 an old man, white with ancient hair, 84 crying out: "Woe to you, wicked souls!
85 Never hope to see heaven: 86 I come to take you to the other shore, 87 into eternal darkness, into heat and ice.
**Sanskrit:**
82 Evamaśmakamabhimukhena nāvāyāgamānam ājagāma 83 Vṛddhaḥ kaścid atikṛṣṇakeśaḥ, 84 Raudram āha: "Duḥkhitaḥ syātha yūyam pāpātmānaḥ!
85 Svargam draṣṭum mā kaścid āśiṣaḥ kuruta: 86 Aham āgacchāmi yūyam anyataḥ tīram nayitum, 87 Nityatamaḥsvabhāve uṣṇe śīte ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 E tu che se’ costì, anima viva, 89 pàrtiti da cotesti che son morti». 90 Ma poi che vide ch’io non mi partiva,
91 disse: «Per altra via, per altri porti 92 verrai a piaggia, non qui, per passare: 93 più lieve legno convien che ti porti».
query.result:
**English:**
88 And you who are there, a living soul, 89 depart from those who are dead." 90 But when he saw that I did not depart,
91 he said: "By another way, by other passages 92 you will come to the shore, not here, to cross over: 93 a lighter vessel must carry you."
**Sanskrit:**
88 Evaṃ ca tvaṃ yaḥ asi atra jīvātmā, 89 pravibhajyāsmai tebhyaḥ ye mṛtāḥ santi. 90 Yada tu adṛśyat māmapi na pravibhajamānam,
91 Abravīt: "Anyena mārgeṇa, anyaiḥ dvāraiḥ 92 Āgacchasi tīram, na atra, yathoktam, atītaye: 93 Laghutaram dāru tavaivahartuṃ śakyam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 E ’l duca lui: «Caron, non ti crucciare: 95 vuolsi così colà dove si puote 96 ciò che si vuole, e più non dimandare».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And the leader said to him: "Charon, do not be angry: 95 it is so willed there where what is willed can be done, 96 and ask no more."
**Sanskrit:**
94 Evaṃ ca tasya nāyakaḥ uvāca: "Kāruṇa, mā krodhaḥ: 95 Tathāiva icchati tatra yatra icchā śakyate, 96 Na ca adhikaṃ पृच्छasi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Quinci fuor quete le lanose gote 98 al nocchier de la livida palude, 99 che ’ntorno a li occhi avea di fiamme rote.
query.result:
**English:**
97 From there he thrust those muddy cheeks aside, 98 the ferryman of the livid marsh, 99 who had eyes circled with flames of fire.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Tataḥsaḥpārsvayorjalapūrṇegaṇḍe 98 nīlāmbhasasrotasaḥpautraḥ, 99 yasyaśikhāmaṇḍalīcakṣuṣoḥparitaḥāsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Ma quell’ anime, ch’eran lasse e nude, 101 cangiar colore e dibattero i denti, 102 ratto che ’nteser le parole crude.
query.result:
**English:**
100 But those souls, who were weary and naked, 101 changed color and gnashed their teeth, 102 as soon as they heard the harsh words.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Tathāpi tāḥ ātmānaḥ, yāḥ śrāntāḥ namagnāśca āsīt, 101 varṇam vivartya dantaśca tāḍayām āsuḥ, 102 yadā tadā kathināḥ vacanaḥ aśṛṇvan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Bestemmiavano Dio e lor parenti, 104 l’umana spezie e ’l loco e ’l tempo e ’l seme 105 di lor semenza e di lor nascimenti.
query.result:
**English:**
103 They blasphemed God and their parents, 104 the human race, the place, the time, and the seed 105 of their seed and of their births.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Devān pitṝnśca nindanti sma, 104 mānuṣīṃ jātim deśakālam ca, 105 sva-bījasya janma ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Poi si ritrasser tutte quante insieme, 107 forte piangendo, a la riva malvagia 108 ch’attende ciascun uom che Dio non teme.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Then they all gathered together, 107 weeping loudly, on the evil shore 108 that awaits every man who does not fear God.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Tataḥ sarvāḥ saha samāgatāḥ, 107 mahān rodayantyaḥ, tatīre duṣṭe, 108 yat pratipekṣate sarvaḥ puruṣaḥ yaḥ devam na bibheti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Caron dimonio, con occhi di bragia 110 loro accennando, tutte le raccoglie; 111 batte col remo qualunque s’adagia.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Charon the demon, with eyes of burning coal, 110 beckoning to them, gathers them all together; 111 he beats with his oar anyone who lingers.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Caraṇaḥ piśācaḥ, angāravatībhyām akṣibhyām, 110 tābhyaḥ saṅketaṃ kṛtvā, sarvāṇi saṃgṛhṇāti; 111 yaḥ kaścid viśrāmyati, tam eva taḍayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Come d’autunno si levan le foglie 113 l’una appresso de l’altra, fin che ’l ramo 114 vede a la terra tutte le sue spoglie,
115 similemente il mal seme d’Adamo 116 gittansi di quel lito ad una ad una, 117 per cenni come augel per suo richiamo.
query.result:
**English:**
112 As in autumn the leaves fall, 113 one after the other, until the branch 114 sees all its spoils upon the ground,
115 in the same way the evil seed of Adam 116 cast themselves down from that bank, one by one, 117 at signals like birds at their call.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Yathā śaratkāle patrāṇi patanti 113 Ekam anyasya paścāt, yāvat śākhā 114 Sarvāṇi svasya vastrāṇi bhūmau paśyati,
115 Tathā eva Ādamasya pāpabījam 116 Ekādhikamekena tatas tāṭaḥ patati, 117 Saṅketaiḥ pakṣiṇām iva sva-āhvāna-niyamena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Così sen vanno su per l’onda bruna, 119 e avanti che sien di là discese, 120 anche di qua nuova schiera s’auna.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Thus they go on over the brown waves, 119 and before those on the other side have disembarked, 120 another new group gathers on this side.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Evam te yānti upari nalina-varṇa-tarangeṣu, 119 ca pūrvaṃ teṣāṃ tatra ava-tāraṇāt, 120 atra api anyā nava-śreṇī sam-āgacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Quinci non passa mai anima buona; 128 e però, se Caron di te si lagna, 129 ben puoi sapere omai che ’l suo dir suona».
query.result:
**English:**
127 No good soul ever passes this way; 128 and therefore, if Charon is angry with you, 129 you can now well understand what his words mean.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Atra na kadācidapi punyātma gacchati; 128 Ata eva, yadi Caronaḥ tava viṣaye kṣubhitaḥ asti, 129 Tasyavacanam kim artham āha, tad adhunā tvam suṣṭhu jānāsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Finito questo, la buia campagna 131 tremò sì forte, che de lo spavento 132 la mente di sudore ancor mi bagna.
query.result:
**English:**
130 When this was finished, the dark countryside 131 trembled so violently that, from the terror, 132 my mind still bathes in sweat.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Iti sampanne, tamasomayaṃ bhūmiḥ 131 Atīva cakampa, yatas trastaḥ 132 Manasā svedena idānīm api snāmi.
